accuracy.description: The correctness of the final answer provided by the system.

accepted_values.0.5: Partially correct, but some details are inaccurate or missing.

reasoning_traceability.description: The ability to follow the logical steps or reasoning of the system to understand how the final answer was derived.

accepted_values.clear: The reasoning process is clearly and explicitly stated.
accepted_values.partial: Some reasoning steps are provided, but not all are clear or complete.
accepted_values.none: No reasoning trace is provided or it is not comprehensible.

completeness.description: The extent to which the solution addresses all components of the question.

accepted_values.complete: All aspects of the question are addressed in the solution.
accepted_values.partial: Some aspects of the question are addressed, but others are omitted.
accepted_values.incomplete: The solution does not adequately address the question posed.

non_redundancy.description: The degree to which the system's output contains information that is non-redundant, precise, and to the point.

accepted_values.some: There is some redundant information, but it does not obscure the message.
accepted_values.high: The response contains a lot of redundant information that makes it difficult to extract useful insights.

efficiency.description: How efficiently the system reaches the solution in terms of computational resources and time.

accepted_values.high: Solution is reached with optimal use of resources and in minimal time.
accepted_values.medium: Solution uses a reasonable amount of resources but may not be optimal.
accepted_values.low: Solution requires excessive resources or time to achieve.

data_contamination_prevention.description: The extent to which the system prevents the use of incorrect or unverified data, including avoiding plagiarism from internet sources.

accepted_values.full: The system shows full prevention of data contamination and no plagiarism.
accepted_values.partial: The system shows some prevention of data contamination but may not be fully effective.
accepted_values.none: The system does not prevent data contamination or plagiarism.

agent_collaboration.description: The quality and effectiveness of the interactions among different agents working on the task.

accepted_values.excellent: Agents collaborate seamlessly, with each contributing effectively to the task.
accepted_values.good: Agents mostly collaborate well, with some minor issues in interaction.
accepted_values.poor: Agents do not collaborate effectively, leading to disjointed or conflicting actions.
